intro: Hibbertia acicularis, commonly known as the slender sandblow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and yellow-orange flowers. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Hibbertia acicularis is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is popular in native gardens.
